metadata.source: Manual curation from news, product announcements, regulatory filings
metadata.note: Edit layer statuses and add events. Push to trigger rebuild.

layers.name: Hold
layers.threshold: 3+ top-25 US banks offer USDC accounts
layers.evidence: GENIUS Act signed July 2025. FDIC proposed rulemaking for bank-issued stablecoins Feb 2026. Crypto-native platforms (Coinbase, Anchorage) offer custody. Traditional banks not yet live with consumer stablecoin accounts.

layers.name: Earn
layers.threshold: Major payroll platform offers stablecoin disbursement
layers.evidence: Deel offers USDC payroll for international contractors. Request Finance enables crypto payroll. No major US payroll platform (ADP, Gusto) offers it to domestic W-2 employees yet.

layers.name: Spend
layers.threshold: Top-20 US retailer accepts stablecoin natively
layers.evidence: Stripe re-enabled stablecoin payments Oct 2024. Shopify accepts USDC via plugins. Visa settling with USDC on Solana. No major retailer accepts directly without payment processor conversion.

layers.name: Borrow
layers.threshold: Bank treats USDC as USD-equivalent collateral
layers.evidence: DeFi lending (Aave, Compound) treats stablecoins as near-equivalent. No US bank offers USD-equivalent lending against stablecoin collateral.

layers.name: Invisible
layers.threshold: Consumer surveys show <50% know which currency they used
layers.evidence: No evidence of abstraction. Users always know whether they are using stablecoins vs. USD.

canary.name: Payroll
canary.description: When a major US payroll platform allows employers to pay in stablecoins and employees to spend without converting, the off-ramp has started dissolving.

secondary_canaries.name: Tax equivalence
secondary_canaries.signal: IRS treats regulated stablecoins as cash equivalents

secondary_canaries.name: 1% of ACH
secondary_canaries.signal: Commercial payment rail competition is real

secondary_canaries.name: Top-25 bank custody
secondary_canaries.signal: Traditional financial system has absorbed stablecoins
